title: Charred Aubergine with Tahini, Pomegranate and Warm Freekeh – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 230°C (fan 210°C). Score the aubergines and rub with olive oil, cumin, garlic, salt and pepper.
Roast for 28–32 minutes until deeply tender and blistered at the edges.
Cook freekeh in salted water for 18–20 minutes until tender; drain well and keep loose.
Warm chickpeas in a small pan with a splash of water and half the lemon zest; season.
Whisk tahini with lemon juice and a tablespoon of warm water to a spoonable sauce; adjust salt.
Rest aubergines 2 minutes, then spoon over any juices.
plating: Spoon freekeh into a loose oval. Add chickpeas alongside. Place aubergine on top, drizzle tahini around the plate, finish with pomegranate and lemon zest.

title: Miso-Roasted Cauliflower Steak with Edamame and Ginger Broth – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Slice cauliflower into two thick ‘steaks’ (reserve florets for another use).
Mix miso, tamari, ginger and 2 tbsp hot water. Brush over cauliflower and roast 20–22 minutes, turning once.
Warm edamame in a small pan with a splash of water and a pinch of salt.
Stir rice vinegar into the remaining miso glaze and loosen with hot water to make a light broth.
Warm the broth gently (do not boil), then finish with sesame oil.
Rest cauliflower 2 minutes before plating.
plating: Pool the ginger broth first. Set the cauliflower steak slightly off-centre, scatter edamame, then finish with spring onion and sesame seeds.

title: Wild Mushroom and Lentil Ragù with Polenta and Chive Oil – Foodie Fuel
method: Sweat shallot in olive oil for 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add mushrooms and cook on high heat 6–8 minutes until browned.
Stir in tomato purée, then add stock and lentils. Simmer 8–10 minutes until glossy.
Cook polenta in salted water per packet (typically 8–10 minutes), stirring until smooth.
Stir chives into 1 tbsp olive oil with a pinch of salt to make chive oil.
Taste ragù for salt and acidity; rest 2 minutes.
plating: Spoon polenta into a shallow base. Add ragù in the centre, then drizzle chive oil around the edge for a clean finish.

title: Smoked Paprika Butter Beans with Charred Greens and Lemon – Foodie Fuel
method: Sweat shallot in olive oil for 3–4 minutes. Add garlic and smoked paprika for 30 seconds.
Add butter beans and stock; simmer 8 minutes until the broth thickens slightly.
Char kale in a hot pan for 3–4 minutes with a pinch of salt until edges crisp.
Finish beans with lemon zest and juice; adjust seasoning.
Rest 2 minutes for flavours to settle.
plating: Spoon beans and broth into a wide bowl. Pile charred greens on top for height and finish with lemon zest.

title: Tofu Cutlets with Sesame–Citrus Slaw and Brown Rice – Foodie Fuel
method: Cook brown rice if needed and keep warm.
Slice tofu into two cutlets. Pat dry and season.
Sear tofu in olive oil for 3–4 minutes per side until golden.
Mix cabbage and carrot with rice vinegar, lime juice, sesame oil and a pinch of salt.
Finish tofu with tamari in the pan for the last 15 seconds to glaze.
Rest 2 minutes before plating.
plating: Mound rice loosely. Add slaw to one side. Place tofu cutlet on top, scatter sesame seeds and spoon any pan glaze around the plate.

title: Roasted Celeriac with Romesco and Crispy Chickpeas – Foodie Fuel

ingredients.item: celeriac, peeled and cut into wedges

method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Toss celeriac wedges with olive oil, salt and pepper; roast 40–45 minutes, turning once.
Toss chickpeas with smoked paprika and a pinch of salt; roast on a separate tray for 18–20 minutes until crisp.
Roast red pepper and garlic cloves for 18 minutes until softened.
Blend roasted pepper, garlic, tomato purée, vinegar and a splash of water into a smooth romesco-style sauce; season.
Rest celeriac 3 minutes before plating.
plating: Swipe romesco across the plate. Stack celeriac neatly, scatter crispy chickpeas, and finish with a clean drizzle of olive oil.

title: Spiced Sweet Potato with Black Bean Salsa and Lime – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Prick sweet potatoes and roast 40–45 minutes until completely tender.
Mix black beans with red onion, tomato, coriander, lime juice and a pinch of salt.
Split potatoes and season the flesh with cumin, paprika and a drizzle of olive oil.
Top with salsa and finish with lime zest.
Rest 2 minutes before serving.
plating: Serve the sweet potato halves on warmed plates. Spoon salsa neatly on top, leaving edges visible, and finish with coriander and lime zest.

title: Tomato and Aubergine Caponata with Grilled Courgette and Basil – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Roast aubergine, tomatoes and onion with olive oil and salt for 25 minutes.
Stir in capers and vinegar, then roast 5 minutes more.
Grill courgette ribbons in a hot pan for 1–2 minutes per side until charred.
Fold basil through the caponata at the end; adjust seasoning.
Rest 3 minutes for flavours to settle.
plating: Spoon caponata into the centre. Drape courgette ribbons on top for height. Finish with torn basil and a clean drizzle of olive oil.

title: Saffron Tomato Orzo with Roasted Peppers and Olive Gremolata – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Roast peppers with half the olive oil and salt for 18–20 minutes.
Sweat shallot in remaining oil for 3 minutes; add garlic for 30 seconds.
Add passata, saffron and 150 ml water; simmer 10 minutes.
Cook orzo in salted water for 8–9 minutes, drain and fold into the tomato sauce.
Mix olives, lemon zest and parsley as a gremolata.
Fold roasted peppers through and finish with gremolata.
plating: Spoon orzo into a neat mound. Arrange peppers visibly on top, then sprinkle olive gremolata for a sharp, clean finish.

title: Harissa-Roasted Carrots with Chickpea Panisse and Herby Salad – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Toss carrots with olive oil, harissa, salt and pepper. Roast 25–30 minutes until caramelised.
Whisk chickpea flour into cold stock, then cook over medium heat 6–8 minutes, stirring, until thick and glossy.
Spread into a lined tray (1.5–2 cm thick). Chill 15 minutes, then cut into rectangles.
Sear panisse in a lightly oiled non-stick pan 2–3 minutes per side until crisp and golden.
Warm chickpeas with a splash of water and lemon juice; season.
Toss herbs with lemon juice and a pinch of salt for a quick salad.
plating: Stack panisse neatly, lean carrots against for height, spoon chickpeas beside, then finish with herb salad. Keep the plate clean and bright.

title: Ricotta Gnocchi with Roast Tomato, Basil and Lemon – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Roast tomatoes with olive oil, garlic and salt for 18–20 minutes.
Mix ricotta, flour, egg, parmesan, lemon zest and a pinch of salt. Form small gnocchi with two spoons.
Poach gnocchi in barely simmering salted water for 2–3 minutes until they float, then lift out.
Toss gnocchi through roasted tomatoes and their juices; warm for 1 minute.
Finish with basil and black pepper.
plating: Spoon tomatoes onto the plate first. Add gnocchi in a loose cluster. Finish with torn basil and parmesan dusting; keep edges clean.

title: Paneer Tikka with Roasted Cauliflower and Mint Yogurt – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 230°C (fan 210°C). Toss cauliflower with olive oil, salt and paprika; roast 18 minutes.
Coat paneer with half the yoghurt, garlic and garam masala. Add to tray and roast 10–12 minutes, turning once.
Mix remaining yoghurt with mint and lime juice; season.
Rest paneer 2 minutes before plating.
plating: Swipe mint yogurt across the plate. Pile cauliflower, then place paneer on top so it stays crisp. Finish with mint.

title: Mushroom, Spinach and Parmesan Risotto with Lemon Zest – Foodie Fuel
method: Sauté shallot in olive oil for 4 minutes. Add garlic for 30 seconds.
Add mushrooms and cook 6–8 minutes until browned.
Stir in rice for 1 minute, then add hot stock a ladle at a time, stirring for 18–20 minutes.
Fold in spinach to wilt, then stir through parmesan and lemon zest.
Rest 2 minutes before serving.
plating: Serve in warm bowls. Tap to level, then finish with lemon zest and a fine parmesan snowfall.

title: Saffron Vegetable Paella with Artichokes and Peas – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat olive oil in a wide pan. Cook onion and pepper for 6 minutes. Add garlic for 30 seconds.
Add rice and stir 1 minute. Add tomatoes, saffron and stock; bring to a simmer.
Cook uncovered 18–20 minutes without stirring much, until rice is just tender.
Add peas and artichokes for the last 5 minutes.
Rest 5 minutes off the heat before plating.
plating: Spoon paella into a clean shallow mound. Arrange artichokes visibly. Finish with black pepper and a tiny drizzle of olive oil.

title: Roasted Beetroot with Whipped Feta, Orange and Pistachio – Foodie Fuel
method: Wrap beetroot in foil and roast at 200°C (fan 180°C) for 45–55 minutes until tender.
Cool slightly, peel, and cut into wedges. Dress with vinegar, olive oil and salt.
Whip feta with yoghurt until smooth.
Plate and finish with orange and pistachio.
plating: Swipe whipped feta, stack beetroot wedges, tuck orange segments, and scatter pistachio for crunch; keep the plate bright and minimal.

title: Halloumi with Charred Peppers, Lentils and Parsley – Foodie Fuel
method: Char peppers in a hot pan for 6–8 minutes until blistered; season.
Warm lentils with garlic, lemon juice and parsley; keep them loose.
Sear halloumi in a dry pan 1–2 minutes per side until golden.
Rest 1 minute, then plate.
plating: Spoon lentils first, add peppers for colour, then lay halloumi on top. Finish with parsley and lemon zest.

title: Burrata with Warm Cannellini Beans and Herb Oil – Foodie Fuel
method: Warm shallot and garlic in olive oil for 3 minutes (no colour).
Add beans and stock; simmer 6–7 minutes until lightly glossy.
Stir in herbs and lemon zest. Season.
Plate beans and top with burrata.
plating: Pool beans and broth, then place burrata centrally. Spoon a little herb oil around and finish with black pepper.

title: Crispy Polenta with Wild Mushrooms and Parmesan – Foodie Fuel
method: Cook polenta in salted water per packet (8–10 minutes). Spread in a tray; chill 20 minutes.
Cut into rectangles and crisp in a hot pan with olive oil 2–3 minutes per side.
Sauté shallot and garlic 3 minutes, add mushrooms and thyme; cook 7 minutes until browned.
Finish mushrooms with parmesan and pepper.
Plate polenta and spoon mushrooms over.
plating: Stack polenta neatly, spoon mushrooms over one side, and finish with parmesan and thyme for a clean, modern look.

title: Shakshuka with Butter Beans and Herby Salad – Foodie Fuel
method: Sauté onion and pepper in olive oil for 8 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and spices for 30 seconds, then add tomatoes and simmer 10 minutes.
Stir in butter beans. Make four wells and crack in eggs.
Cover and cook 6–8 minutes until whites set and yolks still soft.
Finish with parsley and pepper.
plating: Serve in the pan or a wide bowl. Keep eggs visible, spoon sauce around, and finish with herbs for contrast.

title: Roast Squash with Sage, Lentils and Parmesan – Foodie Fuel
method: Roast squash at 220°C (fan 200°C) with olive oil, salt and pepper for 25–28 minutes.
Warm lentils with garlic and lemon juice; season.
Fry sage leaves 20 seconds in a hot dry pan until crisp.
Plate squash over lentils and finish with parmesan shavings and sage.
plating: Spoon lentils as a base, place squash as the hero, then add parmesan shavings and crisp sage for a restaurant finish.

title: Goat’s Cheese Stuffed Peppers with Brown Rice and Herbs – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 200°C (fan 180°C). Roast pepper halves 15 minutes to soften.
Sauté shallot and courgette in olive oil 6 minutes. Stir through rice, parsley and lemon zest.
Fill peppers with rice mix, top with goat’s cheese, and bake 12–15 minutes until golden.
Rest 3 minutes before serving.
plating: Serve two halves per plate, angled to show filling. Finish with parsley and lemon zest; keep the plate uncluttered.

title: Feta-Crusted Aubergine with Tomato Sugo and Greens – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Score aubergine flesh, season and roast 25 minutes.
Simmer shallot and garlic in olive oil 4 minutes, add passata and cook 12 minutes.
Top aubergines with feta and bake 8 minutes until just golden.
Wilt spinach into the sugo at the end and season.
Rest 2 minutes before plating.
plating: Pool sugo, place aubergine on top, then tuck greens to the side. Finish with basil for lift.

title: Courgette and Pea Fritters with Lemon Yogurt and Salad – Foodie Fuel
method: Mix courgette, peas, egg, flour, baking powder, salt and pepper into a thick batter.
Heat a non-stick pan with a thin film of olive oil. Fry fritters 2–3 minutes per side until golden.
Mix yoghurt with lemon zest, juice and a pinch of salt.
Dress rocket lightly with lemon and pepper.
Plate immediately for crispness.
plating: Stack fritters neatly, spoon lemon yoghurt to the side (not over), and add rocket as a fresh counterpoint.

title: Chickpea and Halloumi Stew with Lemon and Dill – Foodie Fuel
method: Sauté onion in olive oil 6 minutes. Add garlic for 30 seconds.
Add tomatoes, stock and chickpeas; simmer 12 minutes until thickened.
Sear halloumi in a dry pan 2–3 minutes until golden, then fold into stew.
Finish with lemon juice and dill.
Rest 2 minutes before serving.
plating: Serve stew in warm bowls with halloumi cubes visible on top. Finish with dill and a final squeeze of lemon.

title: Spinach and Ricotta Cannelloni with Tomato and Basil – Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 200°C (fan 180°C).
Sweat shallot in olive oil for 4 minutes. Add garlic for 30 seconds, then add passata and simmer 10 minutes; season.
Wilt spinach in a hot pan 2–3 minutes, squeeze dry and chop.
Mix spinach with ricotta, half the parmesan, salt and pepper.
Fill cannelloni tubes and lay in a baking dish. Cover with tomato sauce.
Bake 25–30 minutes until bubbling, then finish with remaining parmesan and basil. Rest 5 minutes before serving.
plating: Spoon a little sauce first. Place cannelloni neatly, add a final basil finish and keep edges wiped for a restaurant look.

title: Pan-Roasted Cod with White Bean, Parsley and Lemon Broth – Foodie Fuel
method: Season cod. Sear in olive oil 3 minutes skin/side down, then 2 minutes other side; rest.
Sweat shallot and garlic 3 minutes. Add stock and beans; simmer 6 minutes.
Stir in spinach to wilt. Finish with lemon zest and juice; season.
Warm cod briefly if needed and plate.
plating: Spoon beans and broth first, add greens for height, then place cod on top. Finish with parsley and lemon zest; keep the fish clean.

title: Chicken Supreme with Tarragon Lentils and Roasted Carrots – Foodie Fuel
method: Roast carrots at 210°C (fan 190°C) with olive oil and salt for 22 minutes.
Season chicken. Sear 3 minutes per side, then roast 10–12 minutes to 75°C internal; rest 5 minutes.
Warm lentils with shallot, garlic and stock for 8 minutes; stir in mustard and tarragon.
Taste for salt and balance, then plate.
plating: Spoon lentils as the base, place chicken sliced on the bias, tuck carrots alongside and spoon a little lentil liquor around the plate.

title: Sea with Saffron Tomato, broccoli and butter beans – Foodie Fuel
method: Preheat oven to 210°C (fan 190°C).
Season the protein well. Sear in a hot pan with olive oil for 2–3 minutes per side for colour.
Finish in the oven 6–10 minutes depending on thickness (fish 6–8; meat 8–10). Rest 3–5 minutes.
Warm the beans/lentils gently with shallot, garlic and a splash of water for 6–8 minutes; season.
Cook or warm the carb base and keep it loose (never packed).
Cook the greens/vegetables quickly so they stay vibrant (roast 15–20 minutes or sauté 5–7 minutes).
Build the sauce element (citrus/vinegar/miso/wine reduction) and taste for balance.
Plate with restraint and finish cleanly.
plating: Spoon the carb base first, add the bean element, then place the protein as the hero. Add greens for height and finish with a light sauce around the plate, leaving negative space.

title: Halibut with Mustard And Apple, asparagus and cannellini beans – Foodie Fuel
method: Preheat oven to 210°C (fan 190°C).
Season the protein well. Sear in a hot pan with olive oil for 2–3 minutes per side for colour.
Finish in the oven 6–10 minutes depending on thickness (fish 6–8; meat 8–10). Rest 3–5 minutes.
Warm the beans/lentils gently with shallot, garlic and a splash of water for 6–8 minutes; season.
Cook or warm the carb base and keep it loose (never packed).
Cook the greens/vegetables quickly so they stay vibrant (roast 15–20 minutes or sauté 5–7 minutes).
Build the sauce element (citrus/vinegar/miso/wine reduction) and taste for balance.
Plate with restraint and finish cleanly.
plating: Spoon the carb base first, add the bean element, then place the protein as the hero. Add greens for height and finish with a light sauce around the plate, leaving negative space.
